meanings.definition: A person who assumes something to be true without evidence.
meanings.sent1: The supposers in the story guessed the answer without any proof.
meanings.sent2: The group of supposers at the meeting shared their theories about the missing item.
meanings.sent3: The supposers at the party thought the cake was made of magic!
meanings.sent4: In the land of make-believe, the supposers ruled with their wild ideas.
meanings.sent5: The supposers in the courtroom were convinced of the suspect's guilt.

meanings.definition: Those who believe or imagine something to be the case.
meanings.sent1: The supposers in the movie theater were engrossed in the plot twists.
meanings.sent2: Among the supposers in the class, there were various interpretations of the poem.
meanings.sent3: The supposers at the picnic thought the ants were having a tiny party!
meanings.sent4: Like dreamers in a cloud, the supposers floated through their imagined worlds.
meanings.sent5: The supposers in the audience gasped at the magician's tricks.
